str2: From the base of posis with enclitic adverb of origin; from which or what place, state, source or cause.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
The rite or ceremony of baptism. From baptizo; baptism.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To reason (with), debate (with), consider. From dia and logizomai; to reckon thoroughly, i.e. to deliberate.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
